short_summary: Plan to remove excess soil at Montreal Road Campus.
description: The  National Research Council Canada is seeking  a contractor to remove excess soil  at Montreal Road campus. The contract will consist of two phase.(1) soil removal  and (2) transportation and disposal of Soil. The  successful bidder must demonstrate  the ability to transport the soil  in the short term which  must be completed within the next six months. Due to the complexity of the due diligence process, government agency may retain property without disclosing details to the bidder. ALL interested applicants must attend a site visit for the public procurement to  review the above-mentioned tender. Any other solicitation shall be rejected.
full_summary:
================================
### Tender Announcement
#### **Reference Number:** cb-994-60578518
#### **Tender Solicitation Number:** 23-58123
#### **Tender Closing Date:** November 7, 2023, 14:00
#### **Publication Date:** October 10, 2023

* **Project Title:** Montreal Road Campus, Excess Soil Removal
* **Solicitation Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Procurement Category:** CNST
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

The National Research Council Canada has a requirement for a project that includes the removal and disposal of excess soil in the Council's Buildings M-12 and M-36 parking lots, located at the Montreal Road Campus of the National Research Council.

* **Tender Destination:** Tenders must be submitted electronically to National Research Council Canada.
* **Mandatory Site Visit:** Bidders must participate in a site visit scheduled for October 17th and 18th, 2023.
* **Security Requirements:**
	+ Bidders must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD).
	+ Subcontractors must hold a valid Reliability Status granted or approved by CISD.
	+ All personnel requiring access to sensitive work sites must hold a valid Reliability Status.
* **WSIB (Workplace Safety and Insurance Board):** Bidders must provide a valid WSIB certificate.
* **Contact Information:** Collin Long, Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca, (343) 549-1549

### Important Dates
* **Tender Closing Date:** November 7, 2023, 14:00
* **Site Visit:** October 17th and 18th, 2023
* **Contract Commencement Date:** November 7, 2023
* **Contract Completion Date:** December 15, 2023

To obtain the tender documents, please visit the Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA service provider. Addenda, when issued, will be available from the same source. It is the responsibility of the bidder to ensure they have the latest version of the tender documents.
